meanings.definition: A soft mineral consisting of hydrated magnesium silicate, used in absorbent materials and as a filler in paper and rubber.
meanings.sent1: The sepiolite was mined for its absorbent properties.
meanings.sent2: Miners extracted sepiolite to make paper more smooth.
meanings.sent3: The sepiolite decided to soak up all the spilled water in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like sepiolite, absorbing every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The sepiolite resembled a sponge, eagerly soaking up any liquid it encountered.

meanings.definition: A type of clay mineral that is often found in sedimentary rocks.
meanings.sent1: The sepiolite in the rocks had a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: Geologists studied the sepiolite to understand its formation.
meanings.sent3: The sepiolite at the bottom of the cliff seemed to be waving.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as solid as sepiolite, unyielding and strong.
meanings.sent5: The sepiolite deposits in the earth's crust held secrets of ancient times.
